qas.question: In what year was the Tibetan government abolished?
In what year did Xinhai revolt against the Qing dynasty?
Where is the Tibet Autonomous Region?
Which battle led to Tibet's incorporation into the People's Republic of China?
What year did the Qing Revolution take place?
Where did Tibet become incorporated into in 1915?

context: Following the Xinhai Revolution against the Qing dynasty in <a1_0><b4_0>1912<b4_0/><a1_0/>, Qing soldiers were disarmed and escorted out of <b5_0>Tibet Area (Ü-Tsang)<b5_0/>. The region subsequently declared its independence in 1913 without recognition by the subsequent Chinese Republican government. Later, Lhasa took control of the western part of Xikang, China. The region maintained its autonomy until 1951 when, following the <a3_0>Battle of Chamdo<a3_0/>, Tibet became incorporated into the <b6_0>People's Republic of China<b6_0/>, and the previous <b7_0>Tibetan government<b7_0/> was abolished in <a0_0>1959<a0_0/> after a failed uprising. Today, China governs <a2_0>western and central Tibet<a2_0/> as the Tibet Autonomous Region while the eastern areas are now mostly ethnic autonomous prefectures within Sichuan, Qinghai and other neighbouring provinces. There are tensions regarding Tibet's political status and dissident groups that are active in exile. It is also said that Tibetan activists in Tibet have been arrested or tortured.
